Name: JHSC
Description: A multi-class Arabic hate-speech corpus of Jordanian-dialect tweets labeled for hate speech presence.
Provider: Jordan University of Science and Technology
Paper Title: Hate speech detection in the Arabic language: corpus design, construction, and evaluation
Affiliations: Jordan University of Science and Technology
SAE Institute, Luminus Technical University College
Abstract: This paper presents a new large-scale, publicly available Arabic hate-speech dataset consisting of 403,688 Jordanian-dialect tweets categorized into four sentiment classes based on the presence and intensity of hate speech. The dataset is constructed by systematically collecting tweets from Twitter between 2014 and 2022, followed by rigorous pre-processing and manual annotation. Machine-learning and deep-learning classifiers (TF-IDF, Word2Vec, AraBERT) are evaluated for detecting hate speech, demonstrating the dataset’s utility in Arabic and Jordanian-dialect NLP research.
